pr_title: TSK-1395: Update Navbar to work without bootstrap 3

timeline.message: TSK-1395: fit navbar to the other components

timeline.bodyText: why should all of these variables and functions be in the app.component? Some of them seem redundant since it's a literal copy of navbar.component? Can you clean up the unused variables/functions?
timeline.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.bodyText: meta tags should only be in index.html, please remove this line

timeline.bodyText: this function is very demanding which can cause slowness in our website. Please implement this using css @media query instead.
timeline.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.bodyText: Please remember to remove all console commands in the future
timeline.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.message: TSK-1395: optimize code and add tests

timeline.bodyText: Please change test name to fit with the component name in TS file. EG: NavBarComponent
timeline.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.bodyText: only use let for variable that can be changed and const for constants that don't change
timeline.author: cnguyen-de

timeline.bodyText: By.css('button') isn't a precise query. You can set the element <button class="navbar__toggle-button" .... />, then you can query By.css('button.navbar__toggle-button'). With this query it will be unambiguous and you will 100% get the desired element. This can remove the risk of getting wrong element when all components are built together.
timeline.author: cnguyen-de
cnguyen-de

timeline.bodyText: routerLinks in html are all hardcoded while url variables aren't used?

replies.bodyText: I actually didn't change the function, only moved it from the old nav-bar component to the app component. So I don't even know why there is a subscription needed. I guess I can just remove it, shouldn't change anything.
